TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Window/SmallCaption extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the title bar of a small window. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Window.SmallCaption class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the title bar of a small window, such as a tool window.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Window.SmallCaption.Active%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallCaption1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#336](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_63_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#336](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_63_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the title bar of an active small window.
Docs.value: A that represents the title bar of an active small window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Active property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Active property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallCaption1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#336](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/535ceb26-f9f7-44ea-9bad-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#336](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/535ceb26-f9f7-44ea-9bad-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the title bar of a disabled small window.
Docs.value: A that represents the title bar of a disabled small window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallCaption3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#338](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/60d2b445-0aad-4c02-939e-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#338](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/60d2b445-0aad-4c02-939e-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the title bar of an inactive small window.
Docs.value: A that represents the title bar of an inactive small window.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Inactive property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Inactive property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallCaption2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#337](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/595c1f2a-d299-436a-b2ed-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#337](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/595c1f2a-d299-436a-b2ed-_1.vb)]
